main event: Several unidentified aerial objects were sighted near Slagle Lake, Louisiana on August 23, 1952. The objects were described as disc-shaped and emitting a glow, moving at very high speeds estimated around 1,000 mph.
interesting points: The objects were observed for only 3-4 seconds before blinking out instantaneously.
All aircraft in the area were moving away from the observer's location, and no conventional aircraft could be found to explain the sightings.
The phenomena were of such short duration that no further investigation could be conducted.
Recommendations were made to check airport records in the vicinity for any light aircraft activity on the nights of August 13-15, 1952.
The report notes that it is possible for the normal night sky to appear to contain moving lights which may be mistaken for unidentified aerial objects.
